questions.text: The Indus Water Treaty was signed between Pakistan and India in:
questions.explanation: The Indus Water Treaty was signed on September 19, 1960, with the World Bank as a mediator.

questions.text: Pakistan joined the United Nations in:
questions.explanation: Pakistan became a member of the United Nations on September 30, 1947.

questions.text: The Simla Agreement between India and Pakistan was signed in:
questions.explanation: The Simla Agreement was signed on July 2, 1972, following the 1971 war.

questions.text: Pakistan is a founding member of which organization?
questions.explanation: Pakistan is a founding member of SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation), established in 1985.

questions.text: The first country to recognize Pakistan after independence was:
questions.explanation: Iran was the first country to recognize Pakistan's independence on August 14, 1947.

questions.text: The Tashkent Declaration was signed in:
questions.explanation: The Tashkent Declaration was signed on January 10, 1966, ending the 1965 Indo-Pakistani War.

questions.text: Pakistan shares its longest border with:
questions.explanation: Pakistan shares its longest border (approximately 3,323 km) with India.

questions.text: OIC (Organisation of Islamic Cooperation) is headquartered in:
questions.explanation: The OIC is headquartered in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Pakistan is an active member of this organization.

questions.text: The Lahore Declaration between India and Pakistan was signed in:
questions.explanation: The Lahore Declaration was signed on February 21, 1999, during Indian PM Vajpayee's visit to Lahore.

questions.text: Pakistan conducted its first nuclear tests in:
questions.explanation: Pakistan conducted its first nuclear tests on May 28, 1998, in response to India's nuclear tests.
